meanings.definition: An act or instance of remembering incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: Her misrecollection of the events led to confusion.
meanings.sent2: The misrecollection of his childhood memories made him doubt their accuracy.
meanings.sent3: His misrecollection of the party theme as superheroes instead of pirates caused laughter among the guests.
meanings.sent4: The misrecollection of time can make a minute feel like an hour.
meanings.sent5: The misrecollection of the address led them to the wrong house.

meanings.sent1: She misrecollections the details of the story every time she tells it.
meanings.sent2: He misrecollections the lyrics of the song, often singing the wrong words.
meanings.sent3: The comedian misrecollections his own jokes, creating new punchlines unintentionally.
meanings.sent4: Misrecollection can sometimes lead to misunderstandings between friends.
meanings.sent5: The witness misrecollections the suspect's appearance, causing a delay in the investigation.
